text:
Edward 'Eddie B' Borysewicz (March 18, 1939 – November 17, 2020) was a Polish-American Olympic cycling coach. He coached the American team that won nine medals at the Olympic Games in Los Angeles in 1984. In 1996, he was honored into the United States Bicycling Hall of Fame.
Borysewicz died of COVID-19 in Drezdenko, Poland on November 17, 2020 at the age of 81.

annotations.surface_form: United States Bicycling Hall of Fame
